verses.verse: Now when Mordecai<WH4782> knew<WH3045> all that was done<WH6213>, Mordecai<WH4782> rent<WH7167> his clothes<WH899>, and put on<WH3847> sackcloth<WH8242> with ashes<WH665>, and went out<WH3318> into the midst<WH8432> of the city<WH5892>, and cried<WH2199> with a loud<WH1419> and a bitter<WH4751> cry<WH2201>;
and he came<WH935> even before<WH6440> the king<WH4428>'s gate<WH8179>: for none might enter<WH935> within the king<WH4428>'s gate<WH8179> clothed<WH3830> with sackcloth<WH8242>.

And in every province<WH4082>, whithersoever<WH4725> the king<WH4428>'s commandment<WH1697> and his decree<WH1881> came<WH5060>, there was great<WH1419> mourning<WH60> among the Jews<WH3064>, and fasting<WH6685>, and weeping<WH1065>, and wailing<WH4553>; and many<WH7227> lay<WH3331> in sackcloth<WH8242> and ashes<WH665>.

And Esther<WH635>'s maidens<WH5291> and her chamberlains<WH5631> came<WH935> and told<WH5046> it her<WH4436>; and the queen was exceedingly<WH3966> grieved<WH2342>: and she sent<WH7971> raiment<WH899> to clothe<WH3847> Mordecai<WH4782>, and to take his sackcloth<WH8242> from off<WH5493> him<WH6901>; but he received it not.

Then called<WH7121> Esther<WH635> for Hathach<WH2047>, one of the king<WH4428>'s chamberlains<WH5631>, whom he had appointed<WH5975> to attend<WH6440> upon her<WH6680>, and charged him to go to Mordecai<WH4782>, to know what this was<WH3045>, and why it was.
So Hathach<WH2047> went forth<WH3318> to Mordecai<WH4782> unto the broad<WH7339> place of the city<WH5892>, which was before<WH6440> the king<WH4428>'s gate<WH8179>.

And Mordecai<WH4782> told<WH5046> him of all that had happened<WH7136> unto him<WH6575>, and the exact sum of the money<WH3701> that Haman<WH2001> had promised<WH559> to pay<WH8254> to the king<WH4428>'s treasuries<WH1595> for the Jews<WH3064>, to destroy them<WH6>.

Also he gave<WH5414> him the copy<WH6572> of the writing<WH3791> of the decree<WH1881> that was given<WH5414> out in Shushan<WH7800> to destroy<WH8045> them<WH7200>, to show it unto Esther<WH635>, and to declare<WH5046> it unto her<WH6680>, and to charge her that she should go in<WH935> unto the king<WH4428>, to make supplication<WH2603> unto him<WH1245>, and to make request before<WH6440> him<WH5971>, for her people.
And Hathach<WH2047> came<WH935> and told<WH5046> Esther<WH635> the words<WH1697> of Mordecai<WH4782>.
Then Esther<WH635> spake<WH559> unto Hathach<WH2047>, and gave him a message<WH6680> unto Mordecai saying<WH4782>:

All the king<WH4428>'s servants<WH5650>, and the people<WH5971> of the king<WH4428>'s provinces<WH4082>, do know<WH3045>, that whosoever<WH376>, whether man or woman<WH802>, shall come<WH935> unto the king<WH4428> into the inner<WH6442> court<WH2691>, who is not called<WH7121>, there is one<WH259> law<WH1881> for him<WH4191>, that he be put to death, except<WH905> those to whom the king<WH4428> shall hold out<WH3447> the golden<WH2091> sceptre<WH8275>, that he may live<WH2421>: but I have not been called<WH7121> to come in<WH935> unto the king<WH4428> these thirty<WH7970> days<WH3117>.
And they told<WH5046> to Mordecai<WH4782> Esther<WH635>'s words<WH1697>.

Then Mordecai<WH4782> bade<WH559> them return answer<WH7725> unto Esther<WH635>, Think<WH1819> not with thyself<WH5315> that thou shalt escape<WH4422> in the king<WH4428>'s house<WH1004>, more than all the Jews<WH3064>.

For if thou altogether<WH2790> holdest thy peace<WH2790> at this time<WH6256>, then will relief<WH7305> and deliverance<WH2020> arise<WH5975> to the Jews<WH3064> from another<WH312> place<WH4725>, but thou and thy father<WH1>'s house<WH1004> will perish<WH6>: and who knoweth<WH3045> whether thou art not come<WH5060> to the kingdom<WH4438> for such a time as this<WH6256>?
Then Esther<WH635> bade<WH559> them return<WH7725> answer unto Mordecai<WH4782>,

Go <WH3212>, gather together<WH3664> all the Jews<WH3064> that are present<WH4672> in Shushan<WH7800>, and fast<WH6684> ye for me<WH398>, and neither eat nor drink<WH8354> three<WH7969> days<WH3117>, night<WH3915> or day<WH3117>: I also and my maidens<WH5291> will fast<WH6684> in like manner<WH3651>; and so will I go<WH935> in unto the king<WH4428>, which is not according to the law<WH1881>: and if I perish<WH6>, I perish<WH6>.
So Mordecai<WH4782> went his way<WH5674>, and did<WH6213> according to all that Esther<WH635> had commanded him<WH6680>.
